entry.et: Middle English hey, from Old English hīeg; akin to Old High German hewi hay, Old English hēawan to hew

def.dt: :herbage and especially grass mowed and cured for fodder
:reward
:bed
:a small sum of money a saving of…$14 million is not hay H. C. Schonberg
:to cut, cure, and store hay
:to feed with hay
John Milton 1838–1905 Am. statesman
river 530 miles (853 kilometers) Canada in N Alberta & S Northwest Territories flowing NE into Great Slave Lake
:an acute allergic reaction to pollen that is usually seasonal and is marked by sneezing, nasal discharge and congestion, and itching and watering of the eyes called also pollinosis
:a common fern (Dennstaedtia punctilobula) of eastern North America with fragrant finely divided pale green fronds

entry.et: Middle English, from Old English hyttan, probably from Old Norse hitta to meet with, hit

def.dt: :to reach with or as if with a blow
:to come in contact with the ball hit the window
:to strike (as a ball) with an object (as a bat, club, or racket) so as to impart or redirect motion
:to cause to come into contact
:to deliver (as a blow) by action
:to apply forcefully or suddenly hit the brakes
:to affect especially detrimentally farmers hit by drought
:to make a request of hit his friend for 10 dollars often used with up
:to discover or meet especially by chance
:to accord with :suit
:reach attain prices hit a new high
:to arrive or appear at, in, or on hit town the best time to hit the stores
:to bite at or on
:to reflect accurately hit the right note
:to reach or strike (as a target) especially for a score in a game or contest couldn't seem to hit the basket
:bat 2b
:to indulge in excessively hit the bottle
:to deal another card to (as in blackjack)
:to strike a blow
:to arrive with a forceful effect like that of a blow the storm hit
:to come into contact with something
:attack
:strike 11b
:bat 1
:to succeed in attaining or coming up with something often used with on or upon hit on a solution
:to be in agreement :suit
:to fire the charge in the cylinders
:to achieve great success
:to get along well :become friends they hit it off immediately
:to make especially sexual overtures to
:to study especially with intensity
:to have a major usually undesirable impact
:to begin or proceed quickly, energetically, or effectively
:to go to bed
:to touch on or at the most important points or places
:to become notably and unexpectedly successful

dro.drp: hit the nail on the head

def.dt: :to be exactly right
:leave travel
:to set out
:to give vent to a burst of anger or angry protest
:to give complete or special satisfaction used especially of food or drink
:to reach the point of physical exhaustion during strenuous activity
:to reach a limiting point or situation at which progress or success ceases

entry.et: Middle English, from Old English macian; akin to Old High German mahhōn to prepare, make, Greek magēnai to be kneaded, Old Church Slavic mazati to anoint, smear

def.dt: :behave act
:to begin or seem to begin (an action) made to go
:to cause to happen to or be experienced by someone made trouble for us
:to cause to exist, occur, or appear :create make a disturbance
:to favor the growth or occurrence of haste makes waste
:to fit, intend, or destine by or as if by creating was made to be an actor
:to bring into being by forming, shaping, or altering material :fashion make a dress
:compose write make verses
:to lay out and construct make a road
:to frame or formulate in the mind make plans
:to put together from components :constitute houses made of stone
:to compute or estimate to be
:to form and hold in the mind make no doubt of it
:to assemble and set alight the materials for (a fire)
:to set in order make beds
:prepare fix make dinner
:to shuffle (a deck of cards) in preparation for dealing
:to prepare (hay) by cutting, drying, and storing
:to cause to be or become made them happy makes it possible
:appoint made him bishop
:enact establish make laws
:to execute in an appropriate manner make a will
:set name make a price
:shut the doors are made against you Shakespeare
:to cause (an electric circuit) to be completed
:to conclude as to the nature or meaning of something what do you make of this development?
:to regard as being not the fool some make him
:to carry out (an action indicated or implied by the object) make war make a speech make a detour
:to perform with a bodily movement make a sweeping gesture
:to produce as a result of action, effort, or behavior with respect to something make a mess of the job tried to make a thorough job of it
:to turn into another language by translation
:to cause to act in a certain way :compel make her give it back
:to cause or assure the success or prosperity of can either make you or break you
:to amount to in significance makes a great difference
:to form the essential being of clothes make the man
:to form by an assembling of individuals make a quorum
:to count as that makes the third time you've said it
:to be or be capable of being changed or fashioned into rags make the best paper
:to develop into she will make a fine judge
:form 6b
:reach attain made port before the storm often used with it you'll never make it that far
:to gain the rank of make major
:to gain a place on or in make the team the story made the papers
:to succeed in providing or obtaining make bail
:to gain (as money) by working, trading, or dealing make a living
:to act so as to earn or acquire makes friends easily makes poor grades
:to score in a game or sport make a field goal make a birdie
:to convert (a split) into a spare in bowling
:to succeed in holing make a putt
:to fulfill (a contract) in a card game
:to win a trick with (a card)
:to include in a route or itinerary make New York on the return trip often used with it make it to the party
:catch 6b made the bus just in time
:to persuade to consent to sexual intercourse :seduce
:to provide the most enjoyable or satisfying experience of meeting the star of the show really made our day
:to compose poetry
:behave act
:to begin or seem to begin a certain action made as though to hand it to me
:to act so as to be or to seem to be make merry
:to play a part usually used with like
:set out head made after the fox made straight for home
:to increase in height or size the tide is making now
:to reach or extend in a certain direction
:to have considerable effect courtesy makes for safer driving
:to undergo manufacture or processing the silk makes up beautifully
:to distort one's features :grimace

dro.drp: make a mountain out of a molehill

def.dt: :to treat a trifling matter as of great importance
:to carry off :steal
:kill
:pretend feign
:venture dare
:to accept bets at calculated odds on all the entrants in a race or contest
:to unite to achieve a shared goal
:to get along or manage with the means at hand
:to make one's means adequate to one's needs
:ogle
:to establish a friendship or friendly relations with
:to make an object of amusement or laughter :ridicule mock
:to make valid or complete: as
:to make up for (a deficiency)
:indemnify make good the loss
:to carry out successfully made good their escape made good on his promise
:prove made good a charge
:to prove to be capable
:succeed
:to make use of a situation or circumstance especially in order to gain an advantage
:to make progress especially against resistance
:to rise in armed revolt
:to be successful trying to make it in the big time as a fashion photographer Joe Kane
:to be satisfactory or pleasing if it isn't danceable, it doesn't make it for me Judy Hyman
:to have sexual intercourse
:survive live half the cubs won't make it through their first year
:to treat as of little account
:woo court
:neck pet
:to engage in sexual intercourse
:to treat as of importance
:to treat with obvious affection or special consideration
:to be deliberately and often insincerely polite and agreeable must make nice to politicians they cannot stand Ken Auletta
:to be straightforward, unhesitating, or sure makes no bones about the seriousness of the matter
:to achieve success or fame
:disclose
:to raise or spread sail
:to set out on a voyage
:to manage with difficulty
:ridicule mock
:to measure up to some standard :be successful
:to show or use to the best advantage
:to be present at or participate in a usually specified activity or event
:to travel fast
:to gain time
:to make progress toward winning favor trying to make time with the waitress
:to proceed at a walk or run
:to go in a hurry :run away flee
:to put to use :employ
:leak
:urinate
:to create a stir or disturbance
:to give room for passing, entering, or occupying
:to make progress
:produce perform usually used with the
